subsection.title: 1. Find the slope of a line

introduction.p: We can tell whether two lines are parallel, perpendicular, or neither by comparing their slopes.

statement.p: Find the slope of the line ~6x-8y = 9

solution.p: The easiest way to find the slope of this line is to put its equation into slope-intercept form by solving for y. -8y \amp = -6x+9 y \amp = \dfrac{-6x+9}{-8} = \dfrac{3}{4}x - \dfrac{9}{8} The slope of the line is \dfrac{3}{4}.

statement.p: Find the slope of the line whose intercepts are (112,0) and (0,140).

solution.p: We use the slope formula. m = \dfrac{y_2-y_1}{x_2-x_1} = \dfrac{140-0}{0-112} = \dfrac{140}{-112} = \dfrac{-5}{4}
